alert.note: Alert for Kuskokwim Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 18 at 4:13PM AKDT until March 20 at 10:00AM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY EVENING THROUGH MONDAY MORNING FOR THE KUSKOKWIM COAST AND NUNIVAK ISLAND... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches possible. Southeast winds could gust as high as 50 mph. Visibilities potentially reduced to one half mile or less at times. * WHERE...Kuskokwim Coast and Nunivak Island. * WHEN...From Sunday evening through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A strong Bering low is expected to bring a front into the Kuskokwim Delta on Monday. Winds gusting to as high as 50 mph and light to moderate snow will promote a threat for blowing snow with significantly reduced visibility down to one half mile or less at times. The area of greatest threat should stretch from Nunivak Island into Toksook Bay, and then southward along the coast to Kipnuk. However, snow and blowing snow may spread as far inland as Bethel through the morning hours on Monday.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
